intro: Gomphostemma javanicum subsp. lucidum, commonly known as the glossy gomphostemma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its opposite, elliptic leaves that are often glossy in appearance. The flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, with four to five petals. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and Malaysia. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
